qas.question: How long was there native Sumerian rule during the Third Dynasty of Ur?
When was the Third Dynasty of Ur?
What language was in use in the Neo-Sumerian Empire?
What is considered to be the world's first city?
How many cultures may have fused together in Eridu?
What Empire was followed by native Sumerian rule?
What dynasty was in power from the 21st to the 20th century BC?
What was the worlds first settlement?
How many cultures could be found in Arabia at the time?

context: Native Sumerian rule re-emerged for <a0_0>about a century<a0_0/> in the <b5_0>Neo-Sumerian Empire<b5_0/> or <b6_0>Third Dynasty of Ur<b6_0/> (Sumerian Renaissance) <a1_0>approximately 2100-2000 BC<a1_0/>, but the <a2_0>Akkadian<a2_0/> language also remained in use. The Sumerian city of <a3_0><b7_0>Eridu<b7_0/><a3_0/>, on the coast of the Persian Gulf, is considered to have been the world's first city, where <a4_0><b8_0>three<b8_0/><a4_0/> separate cultures may have fused — that of peasant Ubaidian farmers, living in mud-brick huts and practicing irrigation; that of mobile nomadic Semitic pastoralists living in black tents and following herds of sheep and goats; and that of fisher folk, living in reed huts in the marshlands, who may have been the ancestors of the Sumerians.
